page.title: 04FYLINGDALES GAZETTEER
page.content: Fishing. There is good fishing in the Bay when the tide is in but it improves out at sea. Cod, haddock, whiting, plaice and shellfish such as crab and lobster are landed. Several kinds of bait may be found on the beach and artificial bait bought at the local shop. Museum. Next to the old mortuary at Fisher Head is the old coroner's room. It houses many local exhibits. Bowling. The green is next to Station Road. Club membership lasts for one season and costs Â£4.00 for children and Â£6.00 for adults. Non-members pay Â£1.00 an hour. Tennis. The courts are open to visitors and residents. It costs Â£10.00 a season or Â£1.50 an hour. Religion. There are several churches and chapels in Bay and Thorpe.
